intro: Plectranthus nyikensis, commonly known as the Nyikeni plectranthus, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pale purple or white, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Plectranthus nyikensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
